results.title: Cognitive development
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College and David Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
This program looks at the work of Jean Piaget and his theories of child development. Piaget divided cognitive development into four stages: sensory-motor; concrete-operational; pre-operational and formal operational. Each of these stages is illustrated, using some of the experiments that he devised. The program concludes by discussing the impact of environment on development, a concept which Piaget did not explore.

results.title: Cognition (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harper & Row, Bay State Film Productions, Richard L. Berman and Glen Howard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines developmental changes in perception, memory, evaluation and reasoning. Includes Piaget’s description of the major stages of development and intelligence and discusses the relevance of attention to detail, recognition and recall memory, conservation of mass and number, and reasoning evaluation.

results.title: Coffee and cigarettes
results.creator_credit: Smokescreen, Joana Vicente, Jason Kliot and Jim Jarmusch
results.brief_description: Coffee and cigarettes are often seen as an aid to facilitating conversation. Made of up eleven small stories, shot in B&W, starring famous faces from the stage and screen we witness some of these conversations. Ordinary, bizarre, whimsical - conversations about a great number of topics, all take place whilst imbibing a hot coffee and dragging on a ciggie. Cast includes Roberto Benigni, Steven Wright, Joie Lee, Cinque Lee, Steve Buscemi, Iggy Pop, Tom Waits, Joe Rigano, Vinny Vella, Vinny Vella Jr, Renne French, E. J. Rodriguerz, Alex Descas, Isaach de Bankole, Cate Blanchett, Meg White, Jack White, Alfred Molina, Steve Coogan, Gza, Rza, Bill Murray, Bill Rice, Taylor Mead.

results.title: Coerver coaching method. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 3 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: one on two combination, overlapping, crosses and through passes, heading, shooting.

results.title: Coerver coaching method. Vol. 2.
results.brief_description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 2 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: moves to beat an opponent, one on one, fakes, moves to get past opponents.

results.title: Coerver coaching method. Vol. 1
results.brief_description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 1 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: ball feeling, fast footwork, shielding and changing direction.

results.title: Coelenterates (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Biomedia Associates and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Focuses on a hydra capturing a daphnia. Compares the reproduction methods of the hydra and obelia. Shows closeups of the physalia and limestone producing polyps in stony corals. Written and photographed by Bruce J. Russell.

results.title: Coelenterata
results.brief_description: This film should be sued in conjunction with the film “hydra coelenterata” shows the structure and behaviours of relation organisms, including examples of the colonial hydrozoan and of the large jellyfish belonging to the scyphozoa and of their alternate generation, the scyphistoma. The anthozoan are represented by anemones, sea-pens, etc and the ctenophora by the common comb-jelly, pleuro-brachia.

results.title: Codling strikes at dusk
results.brief_description: Shows the fight against the codling moth, a pest which costs Australia about $2,000,000 each year. The film illustrates the life cycle of the moth; eggs laid in the calix of hard fruit become larvae, eat into the fruit, and finally enter the dormant chrysalid stage. Metamorphosed into moths, they lay eggs to complete the cycle - twice each year. Shows the ways in which the moth is introduced into unaffected areas.
